trans-unit.source: Shadow maps
trans-unit.target: Shadow maps

trans-unit.source: Stride uses shadow mapping to render shadows. To understand shadow maps, imagine a camera in the center of the sun, so you're looking down from the sun's perspective.
trans-unit.target: Stride uses shadow mapping to render shadows. To understand shadow maps, imagine a camera in the center of the sun, so you're looking down from the sun's perspective.

trans-unit.source: Light and shadow
trans-unit.target: Light and shadow

trans-unit.source: Everything the sun sees is in light. Everything hidden from the sun (ie behind occluders) is in shadow.
trans-unit.target: Everything the sun sees is in light. Everything hidden from the sun (ie behind occluders) is in shadow.

trans-unit.source: From this perspective, Stride creates a shadow map for each light that casts shadows. This tells us how far each visible pixel is from the light. When Stride renders the scene, it checks the position of each pixel in the shadow map to learn if it can be "seen" by the light. If the light can see the pixel, the light is illuminated. If it can't, the pixel is in shadow.
trans-unit.target: From this perspective, Stride creates a shadow map for each light that casts shadows. This tells us how far each visible pixel is from the light. When Stride renders the scene, it checks the position of each pixel in the shadow map to learn if it can be "seen" by the light. If the light can see the pixel, the light is illuminated. If it can't, the pixel is in shadow.

trans-unit.source: The shadow atlas
trans-unit.target: The shadow atlas

trans-unit.source: Shadow maps for each light that casts a shadow are saved in a region of the shadow atlas texture. You can choose how much of the shadow atlas each light uses. The larger the shadow map, the better the shadow quality, but the less space you have for shadow maps from other light sources.
trans-unit.target: Shadow maps for each light that casts a shadow are saved in a region of the shadow atlas texture. You can choose how much of the shadow atlas each light uses. The larger the shadow map, the better the shadow quality, but the less space you have for shadow maps from other light sources.
